Questions.QuestionString: What is upper limit?
Answers: The highest allowed size in the production. You can calculate it from the basic size and the upper deviation
The lowest allowed size and can be calculated from the basic size and the lower deviation
Is calculated by the base line and the tolerance

Questions.QuestionString: What is lower limit?
Answers: The highest allowed size in the production. You can calculate it from the basic size and the upper deviation
The lowest allowed size and can be calculated from the basic size and the lower deviation
Is calculated by the base line minor the tolerance

Questions.QuestionString: In case of clearance fit, what is minimum clearance is
Answers: In case of clearance fit, what is minimum clearance is (page 4)
Result through a combination of upper limit diameter shaft and lower limit diameter hole.
The difference between the diameters of a shaft and a hole if the shaft diameter is larger then the hole diameter

Questions.QuestionString: What requirements and general selection criteria for repair work with a splice are correct?
Answers: As a general rule, replacement should always be preferred to repair
A maximum of four repair splices are permitted in one wire, the ones mounted during aircraft construction are not relevant.
Whenever more than one splice assembly is necessary during repair, the separation minimum of the splices is 0.5 inches.

Questions.QuestionString: Refer to the repair classification and select the repair depending on the repair grade, What does the grade 2 mean?
Answers: A check of the repair is necessary at each C−check.

Answers: A check of the repair is necessary at each C−check.

Answers: A check of the repair is necessary at each C−check.

Questions.QuestionString: Refer to the repair classification and select the repair depending on the repair grade, What does the grade 2 mean?
Answers: A check of the repair is necessary at each C−check.

Questions.QuestionString: Refer to the repair classification and select the repair depending on the repair grade, What does the grade 3 mean?

Generally all types of damages are checked for, but essentially the main types of defect being inspected for are:
Any cleaning fluids used should have been approved by?
For cleaning the use of air jets should be:
General visual inspection (GVI) is made from within?
General visual inspection may require removal or opening of?
For detailed inspection aids such mirrors, magnifying lenses, etc. may be used and what may be required else ?

Questions.QuestionString: A structural damage report information have to be considered about:
Answers: Location of damage, type of damage and extent of damage.

Questions.QuestionString: All corrosion found must be immediately and completely removed because corrosion which remains will cause:
Answers: new corrosion and further decrease the strength of the structure

Questions.QuestionString: Any fasteners located within the area of corrosion and affected by the corrosion must be
Answers: Removed if its head paint damaged

Questions.QuestionString: Any fasteners located within the area of corrosion and affected by the corrosion must be removed due to
Answers: Possible corrosion under the fastener head or in the countersink has to be detected and removed

Questions.QuestionString: What chapter you will find out some abnormal events happen?
What chapter you find out related information after lightning strike?
What chapter you find out maintenance procedures after hard landing?
After severe or unusual Turbulence happened, which task you have to perform?
Avoid the Overweight landing, what procedures captain will do first?
Answers: Request divert and Landing at bigger airport

Questions.QuestionString: Which is the main cause of A/C damage after bird strike?
The regular maintenance carried out is based on the documents issued by the aircraft and equipment manufacturers. They can be as follow:
Answers: Maintenance Review Board Report (MRBR) and Maintenance Planning Data (MPD)
Maintenance Review Board Report (MRBR), Maintenance Planning Data (MPD) and Regulatory Requirements
Maintenance Review Board Report (MRBR), Maintenance Planning Data (MPD), Maintenance Organization Exposition (MOE) and Regulatory Requirements

Questions.QuestionString: What does the maintenance schedule specify
Answers: Maintenance requirements for the aircraft as well as the maximum operating hours for aircraft components as required by regulatory authorities
Maximum operating hours for aircraft components as required by regulatory authorities

Questions.QuestionString: How does the aircraft operator ensure the effectivity of the maintenance procedures
Answers: Base on daily notification of aircraft manufacturer.
Aircraft operator don't need to ensure the effectivity of the maintenance procedures

Questions.QuestionString: Which program are flight-hour sensitive
Answers: Systems Maintenance and Zonal Inspection Programs
Structural Inspection, Systems Maintenance and Zonal Inspection Programs

Questions.QuestionString: In what are task intervals expressed
Answers: Hours, cycles, calendar time, flight day
Hours, cycles, calendar time or a letter check

Questions.QuestionString: Which rating authorizes to carry out maintenance work on aircraft and aircraft components (including engines / APU), provided those aircraft components are built in the aircraft.
What kind of information does the Component Capability List (CCL) provide
Answers: List of the component that are installed on aircraft and Maximum operating hours of those components
Maximum operating hours for aircraft components
List of the part numbers (P/Ns) of parts that have to be maintained in the respective shop.

Questions.QuestionString: Concerning modification, from what can complementary maintenance measures result
Answers: Requirements from authorities (AD, LTA, etc.) only
Requirements from authorities (AD, LTA, etc.) and recommendations from the design / production organizations.
Recommendations from the design / production organizations only

Questions.QuestionString: Who take decision on the accomplishment of Service Bulletin (SB)
Answers: Aircraft / aircraft component owner unless the SB accomplishment is explicitly prescribed by an authority

Questions.QuestionString: What happen to an aircraft or aircraft component if it is not accomplished an effective Authority directives before deadline
Answers: Aircraft or aircraft component is allowed to be used for three month.
Aircraft or aircraft component is not allowed to be used in normal operation anymore
Aircraft or aircraft component is allowed to be used in normal operation

Questions.QuestionString: How must Serviceable material and unserviceable material be stored.
Answers: Serviceable material must be stored separately from unserviceable material
Serviceable material can be stored with unserviceable material provided they is labeled with appropriate tag

Questions.QuestionString: What is rotable component
Answers: Semi-finished products which are not used until processed
Non-repairable aircraft components with part number, which have to be disposed of depending on the usage
Components for which maintenance documents are released.

Questions.QuestionString: When is a release certificate required
Answers: Prior to every flight of an aircraft which underwent maintenance
Prior to every flight of an aircraft which underwent maintenance and after the production of an aircraft component

Questions.QuestionString: Concerning release certificates for component, when can a release certificate be not required
Answers: After the production of an aircraft component
After maintenance on components that instantly installed in an aircraft without intermediate storage,
Release certificates must always be issued after any maintenance on components.

Questions.QuestionString: Within one work package, might a different release certificate be required than for the overall release
Answers: No, a workpack always required only an overall release.
Yes, providing the workpack is for letter check

Questions.QuestionString: Who is responsible for the airworthiness of the aircraft
Answers: Approval maintenance organization provided operator have a contract with them

Questions.QuestionString: What is Hard time
Answers: A preventative process in which information on items gained from operational experience is collected, analyzed and interpreted on a continuing basis as a means of implementing corrective procedures
A preventative process in which known deterioration of an item is limited to an acceptable level by the maintenance actions which are carried out at periods related to time in service
A preventive process but one in which the item is inspected or tested at specified periods, to determine whether it can continue in service

Questions.QuestionString: Concerning Components Operating and Storage Limits (COSL), how is time tracking taken place for a component that is stockpiled in the storage and subject to the operating and storage limits
